item.title: 日本 2 月出口因关税担忧导致囤货而扩大
item.description: 周三的数据显示，日本2月份出口连续第五个月增长，部分原因可能是对美国总统唐纳德-特朗普激进关税政策的担忧与日俱增，导致部分库存增加。【原文：Japan's exports rose for a fifth straight month in February, data showed on Wednesday, possibly boosted in part by some stockpiling amid growing concerns over U.S. President Donald Trump's aggressive tariff policies.】

item.title: 力拓支持双重上市结构，要求股东否决帕利斯特的收购要约
item.description: 矿业巨头力拓周三支持其双重上市结构，并要求股东投票反对总部位于伦敦的对冲基金 Palliser Capital 提出的审查该公司在伦敦和悉尼两地上市的决议。【原文：Mining major Rio Tinto on Wednesday backed its dual-listed structure and asked shareholders to vote against London-based hedge fund Palliser Capital's resolution to review the firm's two listings in London and Sydney.】

item.title: Leapmotor 推出两款电动车在英国销售
item.description: 中国电动汽车制造商飞跃汽车公司（Leapmotor）周三表示，通过与世界第四大汽车制造商的合资企业，该公司已开始在英国的Stellantis经销店销售两款电动汽车。【原文：Chinese EV maker Leapmotor has started selling two electric vehicle models at Stellantis dealerships in Britain via its joint venture with the world's No. 4 automaker, it said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 在严峻的全球市场环境下，宾利创下自 2020 年以来的最低收入纪录
item.description: 宾利周三公布了自2020年COVID疫情以来的最低年收入，这家英国豪华汽车制造商在2024年将面临严峻的全球市场，但它表示正在追求 "价值大于销量"，每辆车的收入比2023年增长了10%。【原文：Bentley on Wednesday posted its lowest annual revenue since the COVID pandemic struck in 2020 as the British luxury automaker faced a tough global market in 2024, but said it was pursuing "value over volume" with revenue per car up 10% versus 2023.】

item.title: Ben & Jerry's称母公司联合利华决定解雇冰淇淋公司首席执行官
item.description: Ben & Jerry's称，其母公司联合利华（Unilever）决定罢免这家冰淇淋生产商的首席执行官戴夫-斯蒂弗（Dave Stever），从而使有关该子公司在社会政策问题上独立性的争论升级。【原文：Ben & Jerry's said its parent, Unilever , decided to oust the ice cream maker's chief executive, Dave Stever, escalating a battle over the subsidiary's independence on social policy issues.】

item.title: 美国司法部长称针对特斯拉财产的袭击为 "国内恐怖主义
item.description: 美国司法部长帕姆-邦迪（Pam Bondi）周二谴责了最近对特斯拉财产的暴力袭击，并补充说司法部已经起诉了几名肇事者。【原文：U.S. Attorney General Pam Bondi on Tuesday condemned recent violent attacks on Tesla property, adding the Department of Justice has already charged several perpetrators.】

item.title: Alphabet 320 亿美元的 Wiz 交易有望为风险投资支持者带来意外之财
item.description: 投资网络安全公司 Wiz 的风险投资公司同意谷歌母公司 Alphabet 以 320 亿美元收购该公司，种子投资者将获得高达 200 倍的回报，其中包括红杉资本（Sequoia Capital）、Cyberstarts 和 Index Ventures。【原文：The venture capital firms that invested in cybersecurity firm Wiz, which agreed to a $32 billion buyout by Google's parent Alphabet , stand to reap returns as high as 200 times for seed investors, among them Sequoia Capital, Cyberstarts and Index Ventures.】

item.title: 澳大利亚 WiseTech 公司创始人怀特承认审查结果导致信息披露不完整
item.description: 澳大利亚 WiseTech Global 公司的创始人兼执行主席承认，在审查发现他的陈述不准确、不完整和具有误导性之后，他应该向董事会全面披露其个人关系的细节。【原文：Australia's WiseTech Global founder and executive chair admitted he should have fully disclosed details of his personal relationship to the board, after a review found his statements were inaccurate, incomplete and misleading.】

item.title: 白宫称对等关税仍将于 4 月 2 日生效
item.description: 一位白宫官员表示，特朗普政府仍打算在 4 月 2 日开始实施对等关税，并澄清了财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）的言论，该言论暗示各国可以在美国政府开始征收新的进口关税之前进行谈判。【原文：The Trump administration still intends for reciprocal tariffs to take effect on April 2, a White House official said, clarifying comments from Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent which suggested countries could negotiate before the U.S. government begins collecting new import duties.】

item.title: 德意志银行让 DWS 首次参与私人信贷交易
item.description: 德意志银行（Deutsche Bank）与其资产管理部门周二表示，德意志银行将优先允许其资产管理部门参与其发起的私人信贷交易。【原文：Deutsche Bank will give its asset management arm preferred access to private credit deals it originates, the companies said on Tuesday, as the German institutions look for an edge in the booming but increasingly competitive market.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，摩根士丹利将裁员约 2000 人
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周二援引知情人士的话报道，摩根士丹利计划在本月晚些时候裁员约 2000 人。【原文：Morgan Stanley is planning to lay off about 2,000 employees later this month, Bloomberg News reported on Tuesday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: Nvidia 在年度开发者大会 GTC 上发布的所有信息
item.description: 本周二，英伟达公司首席执行官黄仁勋（Jensen Huang）在其年度软件开发者大会上发布了该公司的下一代芯片产品线，旨在向投资者保证其在快速发展的人工智能产业中的主导地位。【原文：Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang, on Tuesday, unveiled the company's next-generation line of chips at its annual software developer conference, aiming to reassure investors of its dominance in the rapidly evolving artificial intelligence industry.】

item.title: 需求下滑，加拿大 Alimentation Couche-Tard 公司季度收入不及预期
item.description: 零售商 Alimentation Couche-Tard 周二公布的第三季度营收不及预期，原因是通胀压力上升导致便利店和燃料业务需求低迷。【原文：Retailer Alimentation Couche-Tard missed third-quarter revenue estimates on Tuesday, hurt by sluggish demand in its convenience stores and fuel businesses amid rising inflationary pressures.】

item.title: 交易日：昙花一现的复苏被扼杀
item.description: 交易日【原文：TRADING DAY】

item.title: 日本央行将维持利率稳定，特朗普风险为前景蒙上阴影
item.description: 日本央行周三将维持利率稳定，因为决策者们将花更多时间来衡量美国提高关税的前景将如何影响依赖出口的经济。【原文：The Bank of Japan is set to keep interest rates steady on Wednesday, as policymakers spend more time gauging how prospects of higher U.S. tariffs would affect the export-reliant economy.】

item.title: 甲骨文公司将为新加坡军方提供云计算和人工智能服务
item.description: 甲骨文公司周三表示，它将为新加坡国防技术部门提供 "孤立的 "云计算和人工智能服务，这是该公司在东南亚的首笔此类交易。【原文：Oracle said on Wednesday it would provide Singapore's defense technology arm with "isolated" cloud computing and AI services, in the company's first such deal in Southeast Asia.】

item.title: 特斯拉获得在加利福尼亚州运行机器人轴所需的一系列许可中的第一个许可
item.description: 据加利福尼亚州监管机构称，特斯拉已获得加利福尼亚州一系列批准中的首批批准，这是这家电动汽车制造商最终在该州推出其承诺的机器人出租车服务所必需的。【原文：Tesla has been granted the first in a series of approvals from California that would be required for the electric car maker to eventually launch a promised robotaxi service in the state, according to a state regulator.】

item.title: 代理咨询公司 ISS 支持 Palliser 提出的力拓审查建议
item.description: 机构股东服务公司（ISS）周二敦促力拓（Rio Tinto）股东在激进派 Palliser Capital 的压力下批准一项审查该矿业公司双重上市结构的提案。【原文：Institutional Shareholder Services (ISS) on Tuesday urged Rio Tinto , shareholders to approve a proposal to review the miner's dual-listed structure amid pressure from activist Palliser Capital.】

item.title: 墨西哥 Pemex 公司总裁证实，该公司正与斯利姆商谈 Ixachi 投资事宜
item.description: 墨西哥国家能源公司 Pemex 总裁克劳迪娅-希恩鲍姆（Claudia Sheinbaum）周二表示，该公司正在与亿万富翁投资者卡洛斯-斯利姆（Carlos Slim）旗下的公司就投资该国最重要的天然气田 Ixachi 进行谈判。【原文：Mexican state energy company Pemex is in talks with companies owned by billionaire investor Carlos Slim about an investment in the country's most important natural gas field, Ixachi, President Claudia Sheinbaum said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 美国司法部与西南航空公司就解决航班延误诉讼进行谈判
item.description: 美国司法部周二表示，正在与西南航空公司就解决拜登政府指控该航空公司非法运营长期延误航班的诉讼进行谈判。【原文：The Justice Department on Tuesday said it is in talks with Southwest Airlines about potentially resolving a suit filed by the Biden administration accusing the carrier of illegally operating chronically delayed flights.】

item.title: 西南航空客机在二月险些失事事件中与商务客机擦肩而过，距离商务客机不足 200 英尺
item.description: 美国国家运输安全委员会（National Transportation Safety Board）周二表示，美国西南航空公司一架航班于 2 月 25 日在芝加哥中途机场被迫放弃降落，以险些避免与一架公务机相撞。【原文：A Southwest Airlines flight forced to abort a landing at Chicago Midway Airport on February 25 to narrowly avoid a collision with a business jet was less than 200 feet behind it, the National Transportation Safety Board said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 五人在欧洲议会华为贿赂案调查中被起诉
item.description: 比利时检察院周二表示，它已指控五人涉嫌参与欧洲议会的贿赂调查，据称该调查与中国华为公司（HWT.UL）有关。【原文：The Belgian prosecutor's office said on Tuesday that it has charged five people in connection with a bribery investigation in the European Parliament allegedly linked to China's Huawei (HWT.UL).】

item.title: 黑客帝国》联合制片人 Village Roadshow 在破产后 "接受所有投标
item.description: 美国电影制片商 Village Roadshow Entertainment Group 在申请破产一天后的周二在法庭听证会上表示，对包括《黑客帝国》（The Matrix）、《十一罗汉》（Ocean's Eleven）和《小丑》（The Joker）等知名电影版权在内的电影资料库 "开放接受所有投标"。【原文：U.S. film producer Village Roadshow Entertainment Group is “open to all bids” for a film library that includes rights to well-known movies like The Matrix, Ocean’s Eleven, and The Joker, a company attorney said on Tuesday at a court hearing a day after filing for bankruptcy.】

item.title: 美联航客机在伤人事件发生前导航部件出现故障
item.description: 调查人员称，美国联合航空公司一架波音787喷气客机在1月24日从拉各斯飞往华盛顿的航班上，导航的两个关键部件发生故障，随后飞机突然发生意外移动，导致乘客受伤。【原文：A United Airlines Boeing 787 jetliner on a January 24 flight bound for Washington from Lagos suffered a failure of two key parts for navigation before a sudden unexpected aircraft movement led to passenger injuries, investigators said.】

item.title: 特朗普政策反复无常，股市下跌令一些人重新考虑退休计划
item.description: 54 岁的维克多-费特斯（Victor Fettes）将于下周五退休，这是他计划已久的退休生活。【原文：Victor Fettes, 54, is going ahead with his long-planned retirement next Friday.】

item.title: 大众汽车将出售最多 2.2% 的特拉通股份
item.description: 德国大众汽车公司周二表示，该公司打算出售商用车制造商Traton公司最多1100万股股份，相当于最多2.2%的股份，按周二收盘价计算，价值约3.91亿欧元（4.2787亿美元）。【原文：Volkswagen intends to sell up to 11 million shares in commercial vehicle manufacturer Traton , the German carmaker said on Tuesday, representing up to a 2.2% stake worth about 391 million euros ($427.87 million) at Tuesday's closing price.】

item.title: 通用汽车将使用英伟达人工智能芯片和软件实现车辆和工厂自动化
item.description: 通用汽车公司（General Motors）与英伟达公司（Nvidia）周二表示，通用汽车将使用英伟达的人工智能芯片和软件为其汽车开发自动驾驶汽车技术，并改善其工厂的工作流程。【原文：General Motors will use artificial intelligence chips and software from Nvidia to develop autonomous vehicle technology for its vehicles and improve workflow at its factories, the companies said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 谷歌将支付 2800 万美元解决偏袒白人和亚裔员工的指控
item.description: 谷歌同意支付 2800 万美元，以解决一起集体诉讼，该诉讼称谷歌偏袒白人和亚裔员工，向他们支付更高的薪酬，并将他们置于比其他员工更高的职业发展轨道上。【原文：Google agreed to pay $28 million to settle a class action lawsuit claiming that it favored white and Asian employees by paying them more and putting them on higher career tracks than other workers.】

item.title: 美国上诉法院驳回缺乏 "人类 "创作者的人工智能艺术作品的版权申请
item.description: 华盛顿特区联邦上诉法院周二确认，根据美国法律，人工智能在没有人类输入的情况下生成的艺术作品不能获得版权。【原文：A federal appeals court in Washington, D.C., on Tuesday affirmed that a work of art generated by artificial intelligence without human input cannot be copyrighted under U.S. law.】

item.title: 巴西推出更广泛的所得税免税计划，卢拉寻求重获民心
item.description: 巴西政府周二公布了一项承诺已久的计划，即对月收入不超过 5,000 雷亚尔（合 881.27 美元）的个人免征所得税，收入缺口将通过对高收入者以及汇往国外的利润和红利征收新税来弥补。【原文：Brazil's government on Tuesday unveiled a long-promised plan to exempt individuals earning up to 5,000 reais ($881.27) per month from income tax, with the revenue gap set to be covered by new levies on high earners and profits and dividends sent abroad.】
